description: Schema for the ping content sent by Mozilla's glean telemetry SDK

android_sdk_version.description: The optional Android specific SDK version of the software running on this hardware device.

app_build.description: The build identifier generated by the CI system (e.g. "1234/A"). For language bindings that provide automatic detection for this value, (e.g. Android/Kotlin), in the unlikely event that the build identifier can not be retrieved from the OS, it is set to "inaccessible". For other language bindings, if the value was not provided through configuration, this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

app_channel.description: The channel the application is being distributed on.

app_display_version.description: The user visible version string (e.g. "1.0.3").  In the unlikely event that the display version can not be retrieved, it is set to "inaccessible".

build_date.description: The date & time the application was built

client_id.description: A UUID uniquely identifying the client.

device_manufacturer.description: The manufacturer of the device the application is running on. Not set if the device manufacturer can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

device_model.description: The model of the device the application is running on. On Android, this is Build.MODEL, the user-visible marketing name, like "Pixel 2 XL". Not set if the device model can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

first_run_date.description: The date of the first run of the application.

locale.description: The locale of the application during initialization (e.g. "es-ES"). If the locale can't be determined on the system, the value is ["und"](https://unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unknown_or_Invalid_Identifiers), to indicate "undetermined".

os.description: The name of the operating system. Possible values: Android, iOS, Linux, Darwin, Windows, FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, Solaris, unknown

os_version.description: The user-visible version of the operating system (e.g. "1.2.3"). If the version detection fails, this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

telemetry_sdk_build.description: The version of the Glean SDK

propertyNames.comment: This must be at least the length of 'category.name' metric names to support error reporting

glean.error.invalid_label.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set with an invalid label.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

propertyNames.comment: This must be at least the length of 'category.name' metric names to support error reporting

glean.error.invalid_value.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set to an invalid value.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

propertyNames.comment: This must be at least the length of 'category.name' metric names to support error reporting

glean.error.invalid_state.description:
Counts the number of times a timing metric was used incorrectly.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

propertyNames.comment: This must be at least the length of 'category.name' metric names to support error reporting

glean.error.invalid_overflow.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set a value that overflowed.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

additional_properties.description: A JSON string containing any payload properties not present in the schema

document_id.description: The document ID specified in the URI when the client sent this message

geo.description: Results of a geographic lookup based on the client's IP address

db_version.description: The specific geo database version used for this lookup

subdivision1.description: First major country subdivision, typically a state, province, or county

subdivision2.description: Second major country subdivision; not applicable for most countries

header.description: Headers included in the client's HTTP request

isp.description: Results of ISP lookup based on the client's IP address

db_version.description: The specific geo ISP database version used for this lookup

name.description: The name of the ISP associated with the client's IP address

organization.description: The name of a specific business entity associated with the client's IP address when available; otherwise the ISP name

user_agent.description: Parsed components of the client's user agent string

normalized_app_name.description: Set to "Other" if this message contained an unrecognized app name

normalized_channel.description: Set to "Other" if this message contained an unrecognized channel name

normalized_os.description: Set to "Other" if this message contained an unrecognized OS name

sample_id.description: Hashed version of client_id (if present) useful for partitioning; ranges from 0 to 99

submission_timestamp.description: Time when the ingestion edge server accepted this message

title: Ping transport
